intro: Jasione dentata, commonly known as the toothed jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and spikes of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Jasione dentata is often found in open habitats like grasslands and woodland edges.
